participant_abstract.sent: In our last meeting, we looked at 3 prototype options, evaluated if the selected option conformed to the criteria of remotes we established earlier, checked that our costs met the company requirement and reflected on the technology and group dynamics of the day.
Three design options (the rhombus, the potato/mango, the martian) were shared with the group.
We decided to use the potato, and added a sixth button to the front (much like a Ninendo game piece) for power to prevent using the menu button for two tasks.

We then used the white board to make sure that the remote was acceptable in the following categories: fancy look-and-feel, functional look-and-feel, technological innovation, easy-to-use, spongy, fruit & vegetable considerastion, matches behaviour appropriately, addresses RSI concerns, easy to learn, won't lose, simple, fashionable, meets target audience, incorporates company logo/colors.
We kept costs under 12.5 euros and decided to stick with the design.
